game

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the current level state
    Author:
    Steven Bronsveld

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Level(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String levelPath)
      The level is initialized from the file, properties of the level are set, including the playerX and playerY which are calculated.

      This constructor creates the level not from a file, but from a bunch of parameters

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(android.content.Context context,
             java.lang.String levelPath)
        The level is initialized from the file, properties of the level are set, including the playerX and playerY which are calculated.
        Parameters:
        context - a random context, just used for obtaining
        levelPath - the path of the level file starting in the assets folder (so including level/). An example level name is level/00.sok

      • Level

        public Level(java.lang.String levelName,
             java.lang.String author,
             int playerX,
             int playerY,
             int bestPossibleScore,
             int width,
             int height,
             Tile[][] tiles,
             java.lang.String levelPath)
        This constructor creates the level not from a file, but from a bunch of parameters
        Parameters:
        levelName - The title of the level
        author - The creator of the level
        playerX - The current player x position of this level state
        playerY - The current player y position of this level state
        bestPossibleScore - The minimum amount of steps the level can be completed in
        width - The width of the level
        height - The height of the level
        tiles - A 2D array containing the tiles of the current level state
        levelPath - The path of the original level file from which the level was first created

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the level

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the level

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int x,
                      int y)
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to get the tile at
        y - The y coordinate to get the tile at
        Returns:
        The tile at the given x,y coordinate. If a coordinate outside of the level bounds is requested, an new void tile is returned

        public java.lang.String getLevelName()

        public boolean move(Direction d)
        If possible move the player and if necessary push the boulders
        Parameters:
        d - The direction to move in
        Returns:
        If the move was valid
